Header: ICU of Karapitiya hospital threatened with cessation
Content: The Government Medical Officers Association states that the main Intensive Care Unit of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital has come under threat of imminent closure. Chairman of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital’s GMOA branch Dr. Prishanth Cooray expressing his views in this regard noted that the admission of patients to the ICU was limited at present. Apart from the hospitals main ICU two other intensive care units remain operative. These units include the accident & cancer treatment ICU’s. However around 14 doctors are required to keep all 3 ICU units at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital operational. According to the Chairman of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital’s GMOA branch Dr. Prishanth Cooray, officials concerned have been regularly notified regarding the hospitals dilemma.
